subject: Learning
title: Desirable Difficulties
description: Learn Desirable Difficulties in one minute.

hook.text: A teacher makes a test harder on purpose. Students complain. But they learn 40% more. Difficulty was the point.

buildup.text: Robert Bjork coined 'desirable difficulties'â€”conditions that make learning harder in the moment but stronger long-term.

discovery.text: Spacing, interleaving, and testing are all desirable difficulties. They slow initial learning but boost retention.

twist.text: Students and teachers avoid these methods because they feel inefficient. Easy learning feels better but fades faster.

climax.text: The discomfort during learning is the signal that deep encoding is happening. Embrace the struggle.

punchline.text: If it feels easy, it's probably not sticking. Productive struggle is the secret.

quiz.question: What are desirable difficulties?
options: Conditions that make learning harder short-term but stronger long-term
Unnecessary obstacles that slow down learning
Techniques that make studying feel easy and effortless
